To calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers in Python, you can use the following code: 
```python
numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6] # List of numbers
average = sum(numbers) / len(numbers) # Calculate the average
std(numbers) = st.dev(numbers) # Calculate standard deviation
print("The average is", average)
print(f"The standard deviation is {std:", std}
```
